cause.description:
The Omaha Street School is a private, faith-based, nonprofit organization that seeks to serve in the Omaha metropolitan area to meet the challenge of at-risk youth by providing a school that offers personalized education, a moral code and toolds for self-sufficiency. Characterized by small class sizes that average an eight to one student to teacher ratio, OSS has a Christian atmosphere that includes bible classes and weekly chapel services and a focus on current needs and future opportunities through individualized learning plans for every student. The school is open to anyone who qualifies from age 14 to those whol will graduate by the time they are 21. The school does not receive public funding and is not associated with any public school system. OSS is a member of the National Association of Street Schools and is currently a condidate for accreditation through CITA, the Commission on International and Trans-Regional Accreditation.
1. To break the education failure cycle, student by student.
2. To provide a unique educational ministry environment.
3. To provide students with a sense that they are valued as individuals, that they matter and that they are part of a nurturing family
cause.mission: provide a quality education in a positive environment that encourages academic excellence, high moral standards and personal discipline.
